artist: Engraver: Nathaniel Parr; Painter: After Charles Le Brun
description: Battle scene; Porus in center riding an elephant fighting Roman soldiers; this is the same image as P.47.134
inscription:
Signature, and Inscription

in plate in black: [3/ LeBrun Pinx   Parr Sculp/ PORUS being forsaken by his own People n.th great courage sustain\'d y.e Attacke of his Enemies wound\'d several/ of them & slew Taxiles Brother after n.ch being greviously bruis\'d & wounded he fell from off his Elephant/ PORUS abandonne des siens blisse plusieurs de ceux qui lenvironnent tue le Frere de Taxile &/ apres ce dernier efort de courage il tombe luy meme accable De coups de dessus son Elephant./ Printed for R. Wilkinson at No.58__________ in Cornhill]; on sheet below image in pencil: [1-191]
title: True Valour is always Invincible (La Vraye Valeur est toujours Invincible)
